questions.question: Who is being charged?
questions.description: Names, ages, addresses, other personal information

questions.question: Is the person being charged associated with a particular company, or particular government entity or department?
questions.description: If it is company, you may be able to find details on the CIPC website

questions.question: What is the background of the accused?
questions.description: Include details that may be relevant too in sentencing

questions.question: What statute is the person being charged under?
What is the court (and tier) is the matter being heard at?
What is the charge/charges being pursued?
What is the significance of the action allegedly committed by the person charged, and the effect on others?
Who is the defense attorney or counsel?
What is the date and who is the presiding judge for the trial or hearing?
At what stage is the trial? Is this an appeal? When are the next scheduled hearings?
questions.description: A simple outline of key stages under normal criminal procedure are: Bail hearing; Charges before court and plea; Hearing; Trial-within-a-trial; Judgement; Sentencing and mitigation

questions.question: What is the background to the case and the most relevant facts?
Did this involve a referral/involvement of another agency, ie the Special Investigating Unit?
Are there or have there been any similar cases decided by courts (precedents)?
Additional info/note
questions.description: Approach the Registrar for access to the court file

questions.question: Contact details of people you've interviewed
